When it was first seen, Bioshock Infinite promised to be a proper sequel to Bioshock. Whereas Bioshock 2 simply wallowed in the former's achievements, Infinite appeared to be going to bigger and better places. The 2010 trailer showed Elizabeth's true nature, as an awesome and terrible partner with powers far exceeding that of any Splicer, and it showed off a world that was more subtle, possibly even more twisted than Rapture. The 2011 trailer showed sprawling, massive worlds where big daddies were replaced with massive, hovering gunships spewing fiery death on the lands below, and Booker Dewitt, a man who would tear armies asunder so that Elizabeth would get her freedom, and he would get paid. And most importantly, it gave a glimpse of the world of Columbia, a place so idyllic and spectacular that it could only be twisted and wrong in its every aspect.

Then the game was released.

The racist, anti-utopian and supernatural elements of the plot became shallow and ham-handed in execution, the vigors demonstrated in the early footage were boiled down to what were essentially fancy guns, and Elizabeth was turned into a roomba. Comstock became a raving madman you wouldn't trust if you were a madman yourself, instead of the mysterious figure from before. The massive sprawling streets and buildings of Columbia turned into a linear world, a shadow of System Shock and Bioshock. The city no longer feels "broken" or "wrong" like it originally did, but rather is a simple utopia populated by innocent if racist people that Booker breaks over his knee. The concept of "Anti-Utopia" is completely lost, replaced by a rebellion consistent with any other modern shooter.

I'm not going to discourage you from buying this game. It is good. It is far better than any Call of Duty or Battlefield could ever hope to be. However, to call this game a member of the Bioshock series is distasteful at best.

BioShock Infinite is the latest and last game of the BioShock franchise. The game is the last in the triology and ties up well with the previous games, although BioShock 2 is certainly more of an independant story set in the same universe. Regardless, if you have played any of the previous games you will feel at home with the mechanics rather fast.

At its core you have a first person shooter with various guns which are all balanced with their own strengths and weaknesses. Aside from the classic gunplay you also have a melee weapon which can be used to grapple onto things as well, along with a wide varity of "vigors" which grants you magical powers like freeze, fire, the ability to control mechnical units etc. all of which costs the equivalent of mana. 

The graphics are certainly truly breathtaking, and while not the very best I have seen it does hold up on its own very well. This can also be said about the setting which most of the time is on a floating city in an alternate reality in the 1920's. The setting and amtosphere slowly brings you into the game and some of the absurd things within this reality, but due to the fun and changing gameplay along with an interesting yet complicated story that makes you come back for more all the time. 

Although the game can certainly be played and enjoyed without knowing any of the story it is something which made it that much more enjoyable for me who had played BioShock 1 in the past. With that said you will find various audio tapes to make you understand the setting more.

The game also has two DLC packages that I highly recommend getting, as they are worthwhile it and do feel like true expansions. This is on top of a game which is already quite lengthy enough to give you enough fun for the money you put into it.

Conclusion:
Beautiful graphics, fun gameplay and an incredible story and many hours of it is what you will get with this game. If you have already played BioShock 1 there is no excuse to keep pondering whether to play this game or not, just get it, trust me.

Bioshock Infinite is a really polarizing game, and after finishing it, I understand why. Before you make a purchase, you should try and get a spoiler-free understanding of the game's themes and setting and determine if that is enough to sell you on the game. For me, everything about Inifinite's story was exactly what I was looking for, and I loved every second of it through every term. I sincerely hope that you have managed to avoid spoilers this long; I somehow did, and I can't be more thankful.

The gameplay in Bioshock Inifinite is itself fairly good and enjoyable. There are really two complaints that I have about it that might make the game be just a little bit more frusterating for some users. First, you can only carry 2 weapons at a time. Most of the weapons were pretty good and usable, but there will be some encounters where you will only get 3 or 4 weapons to use at most, and they are often not the ones you would prefer for the situation. Secondly, the growth of your health, shield, and vigor powers are determined by power-ups you find in the environment. This may be fine for you, but personally, I found that upgrading the shields every time was simply the best option for me, especially considering that Infinite lacks the consumable health stimpacks and vigor hypos of the first game. As a result, I ended up holding onto a few key weapons throughout the game and using my vigors very selectively, even though the game constantly reminded me that they were there to play with.

So, if you can look past those strange gameplay regressions from the first Bioshock, and if you really enjoy this kind of story, then you might find that this game is nearly perfect for you, as it was for me.

Колумбия, город над облаками. Это уже не подводный Восторг.  В игре есть всё. Интересный сюжет, содержащий в себе довольно запутанную концовку, есть ураганный геймплей, запоминающиеся персонажи, крайне красивый графоний, хорошее музыкальное сопровождение, а так же отдельные фишки, присущие Биошоку: "плазмиды", навыки (снаряжение), прокачивание оружий и плазмид, etc. Стоит сказать и про детальную проработанность города. Его просто необходимо исследовать. Не просто пробегать, а именно исследовать. В поисках голософонов, различных вывесок, кинескопов, слушать разговоры местных жителей, ну и в конце концов просто любоваться пейзажами и разными постройками. Да и вообще отдельная фишка игры - Элизабет, которая так полюбилась многим игрокам.

Так же хочется упомянуть два сюжетных дополнения: Burial at Sea - Episode 1 и Episode 2. Здесь мы уже перенесёмся в Восторг из первых двух частей. Успеем его увидеть ещё целым, до всего того разброда и шатания, творившегося опять же в первых двух частях. Выглядит тоже впечатляюще, и опять же крайне рекомендовано исследовать городок на предмет интересностей. Геймплей уже не ураганный по сравнению с оригиналом, но это и не минус. А самое главное, сюжет Burial at Sea не только косвенно продолжает и дополняет историю оригинального Инфинита, он ещё и служит предысторией первого Биошока. Эдакий мостик. Узнаем, как Джек попал на самолёт и почему он разбился именно недалеко от Восторговского маяка, узнаем как Фрэнк Фонтейн выбрался на свободу, разберёмся с некоторыми неувязками, оставшимися после основного сюжета. В общем поставим жирную точку в истории всего Биошока. А концовка "Burial at Sea - Ep.2" - ну просто нет слов.

Esta va a ser una reseña bastante critica, si bien aclaro el juego es bueno y entretenido. Dependiendo del estilo de cada quien, puedes pasártelo repartiendo tiros o entreteniéndote  con trampas y plásmidos, sin embargo la variedad es mucho menor en comparación a otras entregas, lo mismo que el nivel de personalización (realmente da lo mismo ir con una u otra arma en cuanto a daño infligido y queda a gusto de cada jugador con cual se acomoda mejor; los plásmidos al ser tan pocos hacia la primera mitad del juego queda claro cuáles son más efectivos y cuáles de plano están solo para rellenar). Podríamos decir que simplificaron la mecánica de juego a fin de que pases más tiempo avanzando que explorando/farmeando/personalizando. Cabe aclarar también, a menos que escojas el modo 1999, aquellos con más recorrer en fps consideraran pasarse el juego cosa de niños ya que el morir no implica mayor contratiempo que quedarte sin dinero e iniciar como si nada. El argumento tiene profundidad, pero el final es apresurado y deja muchas incógnitas. Los dlc profundizan un poco más, pero no terminan de redondear la historia; mención aparte que si no logras cuando menos un 80%/90% de las grabaciones prácticamente no te enteras de que va la historia y su trasfondo. Aqui no hay decisiones que afecten el resultado final. Los gráficos son bastante llamativos (debe ser por la cantidad de luz empleada en las escenas y que contrasta con los juegos anteriores y otros similares). Sin embargo, no esperen un derroche de efectos y realmente no entiendo porque solicita tanto hardware.

En resumen, le doy un 8.5/10. Esperaba un poco más de esta entrega, pero creo que los productores decidieron hacer un juego entretenido y divertido con cierto trasfondo y dejar las historias más profundas en otra liga.

This was a second playthrough, so review is based on that. 

First playthrough took me around ~20 hours, second one taking ~18. Still, I was able to get something new out from Bioshock Infinite. 

As for gameplay: 
It ain't best I have seen, as there are many irritating things, starting from apparent "there is a small rock, you cannot step over it". Battles are similar to most FPS and everything feels like Bioshock 2.5, which ain't  bad, but not a gem either.

... but what matters most is the story! Compared to original Bioshock games, Infinite has amazing character developement! 

Story is knitted so well together that I'm unable to point more than two hollywood movies with script which could rival with details of Bioshock Infinite. Second playthru was great experience, as I was already looking for clues for main story right from the start (and was still able to miss some clear points even from first minutes at the lighthouse scene).

sigh... I believe that Bioshock Infinite is *the best* story ever told on games, when it comes to complexity of story. It may not be the most epic, but there simply ain't one game with as detailed plot as Bioshock Infinite. If you have never played this one, do yourself a favor!

Bioshock Infinite é um jogo incrível. As melhorias em relação a Bioshock e Bioshock 2 são perceptíveis. A ambientação é muito boa e varia de acordo com o momento da campanha,  mas, em geral, os ambientes são amplos e ricos em claridade e reflexos da luz do sol.
Os gráficos estão bonitos e leves. As expressões faciais os personagens estão melhor trabalhadas e, juntamente com a boa ambientação, levam o jogador a um maior envolvimento com o enredo.
O apontador de objetivo e as legendas em Português (BR) tornam o jogo mais compreensível e objetivo. Agora não há mais como os players reclamarem que não entederam o enredo  e/ou os objetivos do game.
A jogabilidade está muito boa e acredito que não deva mais ser foco de reclamação da série.
O jogador não armazena mais medkits e sais (E.V.E. em Bioshock e Bioshock 2), é possível comprá-los e encontrá-los no mapa apenas para uso imediato. Durante os combates, Elizabeth  ajuda muito fornecendo itens coletados como medkits, sais, munição, entre outros.
Em Bioshock Infinite o jogador assume o papel de Booker DeWitt, que recebe uma proposta de resgatar uma garota (Elizabeth) para quitar sua dívida. Booker acaba então encontrando uma cidade flutuante chamada Columbia, onde deveria encontrar Elizabeth. Assim como nos jogos anteriores, Bioshock Infinite é repleto de revelações. O enredo é amplo e complexo, mas como o jogo possui legendas em PT-BR não é difícil compreendê-lo. A abertura de portais para outras dimensões aumentam ainda mais a complexidade da história. Uma ligação direta com Bioshock e Bioshock 2 só será feita no final do game.  Diferentemente dos jogos anteriores, Bioshock Infinite possui apenas 1 final.
Recomendo este game para os fâs da série Bioschock e para aqueles que tem interesse em começar a jogar a série. Não a problemas em jogar primeiro Bioshock Infinite, uma vez que os jogos não são lineares em relação ao enredo.

Бесспорный шедер гениального сценатриста и мастера над сюжетом Кена Левина и студии Irrational Games. Отличная работа визуализаторов и актеров озвучки. Графика выжала все из движка Unreal, картинка выглядит сочно и хочется в нее верить, несмотря на некоторые проблемы с текстурками. Однако сюжет для некотрого контингента людей будет непонятным и трудным, или наборот - слишком легким для восприятия, мыслители же подчерпнут тонны подтекста и увидят многие аллюзии на процессы, которые происходили в Европе прошлого века. Музыкальное сопровождение как всегда восхитительно и пробирает до глубин души. Экшен, если честно, то откровенно уныл, как бы разработчики не пытались разнообразить геймплей вертикальным построением потасовок, разрывами с плюшками, тониками, а так же различными комбо с их участием. По старой традиции, модернизация оружия доп. цацками и тоников спецэффектами, новыми принципами взаимодействия. Но истинные ценители любят серию BioShock вовсе не за экшн-составляющую. После выхода последних DLC, студия Кена Левина закрыта, в сюжете изящно поставлена жирная точка. BioShock скорее всего канул в лету, еще один потенциальный мотив насладится шедевром.

Bioshock infinite un juego casi perfecto, desde prácticamente cualquier punto de vista, gráfico,  su historia, la jugabilidad, desde practicamente todos los puntos es un gran juego, pero una de las críticas que se le puede hacer y el lugar desde el cuál lo voy a tomar es la cuestión del "Season pass" y el juego como tal.
El juego como tal es estupendo, posee una de las historias más sólidas y profundas que vi en mi vida, El juego te pone en el cuerpo de Booker Dewitt, un personaje del cuál poco sabes en el principio del juego, el jugador sólo sabe que está endeudado y le ofrecieron un trato para saldar su deuda, " Traenos la chica y saldarás tu deuda", lo que a Dewitt jamás le habían dicho era que la ciudad, Columbia, estaba en las nubes. A medida que el juego avanza encontrás a la chica que te mandan a buscar, Elizabeth, una chica la cuál ha vivido toda su vida en una torre y todo lo que sabe del exterior es por libros. Estos 2 personajes viajarán juntos durante la mayor parte del juego e irán conociéndose mutuamente a lo largo del mismo. A medida de que nos vamos metiendo por la ciudad iremos viendo como el Profeta tiene una visión un poco torcida e iremos viéndolo a lo largo de todo el juego.
La jugabilidad toma muchas cosas de Bioshock 2, como la posibilidad de usar armas y plásmidos, los cuáles en Columbia se llamarán vigorizadores; sino que también incorpora la posibilidad de correr, un escudo, y una nueva mecánica para los combates la cuál  son aerocarriles por los cuáles podrás moverte y combatir. También contaremos con enemigos nuevos, puesto que los viejos y conocidos sptizers ya no estarán.
Hace gala de unos gráficos impecables, utilizando el motor gráfico de Unreal, podremos ver iluminación en tiempo real, unas texturas buenas, no son demasiado especial, pero están bien, y a pesar de esto el juego da en cada momento una excelente sensación de ambientación y en cada momento se podrá sacar una foto que será hermosa. 
--------NOTA "FINAL": 10

Ahora es donde viene el problema, el juego en sí termina dejando muchas incógnitas y llega el tan alabado Seasson pass y plantea más dudas, aunque finalmente logra aclarar todo y armar una conexión, la cuál parecía no estar entre el Bioshock 1 y el Infinite, El Season pass, tranquilamente podría haber sido del juego y no cobrarte  $15 más por algo que forma parte de la historia del mismo.
Por un momento me alegré al saber que Ken Levine, el guionista del Bioshock y el Bioshock Infinite y líder de Irrational games, anunció que éste juego cerraría la saga de Bioshock, lamentablemente y, como es normal hoy en día una distribuidora como 2K  quiere sacar provecho de un juego exitoso hasta fnalmente, matarlo. La distribuidora 2K anuncio que saldría otra entrega de Bioshock, lo cuál realmente me dió mucho miedo, pero no podemos hacer nada mas que esperar y rezar por que 2K no haga cagadas.
--------------NOTA FINAL: 9,5

BioShock Infinite is an artistic masterpiece. Beautiful, suspenseful, and haunting at times; it captures a blending of history and myth to create something both wonderfully unique and familiar.

Story: 10/10
As we all come to expect from Irrational, the plot of this game is bursting with rich parallels, powerful emotional imagery and an ending (brilliantly foreshadowed throughout) that will leave you both satisfied and begging for more.

Ambiance: 11/10
This is where the game really shines. Each set-piece alone could be a work of art, each architectural blend, each cultural costume. All of the visual splendor mixed together with a score that perfectly juxtaposes the glamor and grit of what Columbia represents.

Gamplay: 10/10
I expected a rich story and beautiful visuals/music, what I did not expect was game-play (particularly combat) that surpassed Irrationals previous games in terms of enjoyment and dynamic action. This game takes everything that we loved from previous BioShock games and adds a whole new level of tactical planning and on the fly improvisation. Each combat area is a stage set for a brilliant play, each enemy adding new challenge, each weapon a chance to master. Never has combat been so challenging and satisfying in a BioShock game.

Overall: 10/10 Irrational proves once again that you don't have to break the mold, nor pander to the lowest common denominator to create a brilliant experience.
